name: HostedZone
description: The AWS::Route53::HostedZone resource creates a hosted zone, which can contain a collection of record sets for a domain. You cannot create a hosted zone for a top-level domain (TLD). For more information, see POST CreateHostedZone or POST CreateHostedZone (Private) in the Amazon Route 53 API Reference.

properties.name: HostedZoneConfig
properties.description: A complex type that contains an optional comment about your hosted zone.

properties.name: HostedZoneTags
properties.description: An arbitrary set of tags (key–value pairs) for this hosted zone.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The name of the domain. For resource record types that include a domain name, specify a fully qualified domain name.

properties.name: VPCs
properties.description: One or more VPCs that you want to associate with this hosted zone. When you specify this property, AWS CloudFormation creates a private hosted zone.
